DataElement.preferredName: Residual Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Mesial Surface Buccal Surface Pulp Horn Involvement Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field related to the mesial (side of the tooth facing the midline), buccal (the surface of the tooth facing or in direct contact with the oral mucosa of the cheek), pulp horn (portion of the pulp chamber that extends towards a cusp) surface involvement of the residual tooth decay that has invaded the dentin of tooth 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Residual Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Mesial Surface Buccal Surface Pulp Horn Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the mesial (side of the tooth facing the midline), buccal (the surface of the tooth facing or in direct contact with the oral mucosa of the cheek), pulp horn (portion of the pulp chamber that extends towards a cusp) surface involvement of the residual tooth decay that has invaded the dentin of tooth 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Remaining or left behind.:Tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, the porous, yellow-hued material between the enamel and pulp of the tooth.:The first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system.

Concepts.definition: Tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, creating dentin that is partially demineralized and containing mineral crystals in the tubules.
The first, permanent, six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system.

Property.preferredName: Mesial Surface Buccal Surface Pulp Horn Involvement
Property.preferredDefinition: That side of the tooth facing the midline.:The surface of the tooth facing or in direct contact with the oral mucosa of the cheek.:The portion of the pulp chamber that extends towards a cusp.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: That side of the tooth facing the midline.
The surface of the tooth facing or in direct contact with the oral mucosa of the cheek.
The portion of the pulp chamber that extends towards a cusp.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field related to therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.
